name: Personality Type Differentiation
description: A deep dive into the distinct characteristics of Psychopaths, Sociopaths, and Narcissists.

cards.title: The Psychopath: Cold, Calculated, and Controlled
cards.description: Understanding the psychopathic mind and its lack of empathy.
bulletpoints: Psychopaths are highly manipulative but operate with long-term strategic planning.
They have a shallow emotional range but can feign emotions to manipulate others.
Their lack of guilt and remorse makes them highly dangerous in leadership roles.
cards.summaryText: Recognize the long-game strategists who fake emotions to maneuver, see through the shallow performance because real feeling isn't there, and understand zero guilt or remorse makes them lethal in power.

cards.title: The Sociopath: Impulsive, Erratic, and Aggressive
cards.description: Analyzing the unpredictable and volatile nature of sociopaths.
bulletpoints: Sociopaths are prone to outbursts and emotional instability, making them easy to provoke.
They lack long-term planning, often resorting to reactive and impulsive tactics.
Unlike psychopaths, sociopaths struggle to maintain deep cover for extended periods.
cards.summaryText: Spot the volatile reactors whose emotional storms make them easy to bait, recognize the absence of planning that leads to impulsive, sloppy moves, and exploit their inability to hold a mask for long.

cards.title: The Narcissist: Image-Obsessed and Manipulative
cards.description: Breaking down the core behaviors of narcissistic individuals.
bulletpoints: Narcissists rely on admiration and validation, making them vulnerable to public exposure.
They use gaslighting and emotional manipulation to maintain control over their victims.
Unlike psychopaths and sociopaths, narcissists can be deeply insecure and fragile when exposed.
cards.summaryText: See the validation addicts whose need for admiration is their Achilles' heel, understand gaslighting and emotional manipulation are their core tools, and know exposure shatters their fragile inner self.
